title: ¬´SQL BASICS¬ª ’ï’Ü‘º‘±’Ö’Ü ‘¥‘±’ç‘∏’Ü‘π‘±’ë
content:
’à’û’í’Ñ ’Ä‘±’Ñ‘±’ê ‘∑ ’Ü‘±‘Ω‘±’è‘µ’ç’é‘±‘æ

‘¥’°’Ω’®’∂’©’°÷Å’® ’∂’°’≠’°’ø’•’Ω’æ’°’Æ ’ß ’Ω’Ø’Ω’∂’°’Ø data analyst-’∂’•÷Ä’´, SQL developer-’∂’•÷Ä’´, ’æ’•÷Ä’¨’∏÷Ç’Æ’°’¢’°’∂’∂’•÷Ä’´, ÷Ü’´’∂’°’∂’Ω’´’Ω’ø’∂’•÷Ä’´, ’∞’°’∑’æ’°’∫’°’∞’∂’•÷Ä’´, ’æ’´’≥’°’Ø’°’£’´÷Ä’∂’•÷Ä’´ ’∞’°’¥’°÷Ä, ’∏’æ÷Ñ’•÷Ä ’∞’•’ø’°÷Ñ÷Ä÷Ñ÷Ä’æ’°’Æ ’•’∂ ’¢’°’¶’°’∂’•÷Ä’´ ’∞’•’ø ’Ø’°’∫’°’Ø÷Å’æ’°’Æ ’°’∑’≠’°’ø’°’∂÷Ñ’∏’æ, ’´’∂÷Ü’∏÷Ä’¥’°÷Å’´’°’µ’´ ’¥’∑’°’Ø’¥’°’∂ ’Æ’°’æ’°’¨’∂’•÷Ä’´ ÷á ’¥’•’©’∏’§’∂’•÷Ä’´ ’®’∂’§’¨’°’µ’∂’∏÷Ç’¥’∏’æ: ‘Ω’∏’Ω’æ’•’¨’∏÷Ç ’ß (SQL statement, Procedures, Functions, DML, DDL, Joins, TRANSACT SQL, SQL Server Database Administration Logins Identity used to connect to a SQL Server instance (create, alter, drop) Users Database user to log into SQL Server (create, drop) SQL Server Programming Functions Create and drop functions Procedures Create and drop stored procedures Literals (Constants) String, integer, decimal, and DateTime literals Declare Variables Declare variables and set variables Loops and Conditional Statements WHILE Loop, IF...ELSE statement Sequences (Autonumber) Create and drop sequences Comments within SQL How to create comments within your SQL statement ÷á ’°’µ’¨’∂) ’∞’°÷Ä÷Å’∏÷Ç’¥’∂’•÷Ä ’Ω’ø’•’≤’Æ’•’¨’∏÷Ç, ’§÷Ä’°’∂÷Ñ ’¥’∏’§’´÷Ü’´’Ø’°÷Å’∂’•’¨’∏÷Ç, ’ø’°÷Ä’¢’•÷Ä ÷Ü’∏÷Ä’¥’°’ø’´ ’°’≤’¢’µ’∏÷Ç÷Ä’∂’•÷Ä’∏÷Ç’¥ ’£’ø’∂’æ’∏’≤ ’¥’´ ÷Ñ’°’∂’´ ’ø’æ’µ’°’¨’∂’•÷Ä’´ ’¢’°’¶’°’∂’•÷Ä’´ ’Ø’°’∫’°’Ø÷Å’¥’°’∂ ÷á ’Ø’∏’¥’∫’¨’•÷Ñ’Ω ’æ’•’¨’∏÷Ç’Æ’°’Ø’°’∂ ’¥’∑’°’Ø’¥’°’∂ ’∞’∂’°÷Ä’°’æ’∏÷Ä’∏÷Ç’©’µ’∏÷Ç’∂’∂’•÷Ä’´ ’∏÷Ç ’§÷Ä’°’∂’∏’æ ’∞’•’º’°’∞’°÷Ä ’°’∑’≠’°’ø’°’∂÷Ñ’´ ’¥’°’Ω’´’∂:

 

‘µ’û’ê‘≤, ’à’ê’è‘µ’û ’Ç ‘µ’é ‘ª’û’Ü’â ’è‘µ’é’à’Ç’à’í‘π’Ö‘±’Ñ‘≤

‘µ’û’ê‘≤: ’ç’Ø’Ω’°’Æ ’∞’∏÷Ç’∂’´’Ω’´ 16-’´÷Å` ’•÷Ä’•’Ø’∏’µ’°’∂ 20.00-22.00 ’®’∂’Ø’°’Æ ’∞’°’ø’æ’°’Æ’∏÷Ç’¥:

’à’ê’è‘µ’û ’Ç: ‘¥’°’Ω’®’∂’©’°÷Å’® ’°’∂÷Å’Ø’°÷Å’æ’∏÷Ç’¥ ’ß ÷Ö’∂’¨’°’µ’∂ ÷Ü’∏÷Ä’¥’°’ø’∏’æ’ù Skype ’≠’¥’¢’°’µ’´’∂ ’¶’°’∂’£’´ ’¥’´’ª’∏÷Å’∏’æ:

‘ª’û’Ü’â ’è‘µ’é’à’Ç’à’í‘π’Ö‘±’Ñ‘≤: ‘¥’°’Ω’®’∂’©’°÷Å’® ’Ø’°’¶’¥’æ’°’Æ ’ß 12 ’§’°’Ω’´÷Å, ’∏÷Ä’∏’∂÷Ñ ’Ø’°’∂÷Å’Ø’°÷Å’æ’•’∂ ’∑’°’¢’°’©’°’Ø’°’∂ 2 ’°’∂’£’°’¥` ’•÷Ä’•÷Ñ’∑’°’¢’©’´ ÷á ’∏÷Ç÷Ä’¢’°’© ÷Ö÷Ä’•÷Ä’´’∂:

’ñ’à’ê’Ñ‘±’è‘∏
’ï÷Ü’¨’°’µ’∂ ÷á/’Ø’°’¥ ÷Ö’∂’¨’°’µ’∂, ’Ø’∏’∂’Ø÷Ä’•’ø ’°’µ’Ω ’°’∂’£’°’¥’ù o’∂’¨’°’µ’∂: ‘¥’°’Ω’•÷Ä’´ ’∞’•’ø ‘±’Ü’é’É‘±’ê ’ø÷Ä’°’¥’°’§÷Ä’æ’∏÷Ç’¥ ’•’∂ ¬´‘≤’°’¶’°’µ’´’∂ Excel¬ª ÷á ¬´‘Ω’∏÷Ä’°÷Å’æ’°’Æ Excel¬ª ’§’°’Ω’®’∂’©’°÷Å’∂’•÷Ä’´ ’æ’´’§’•’∏’∂’µ’∏÷Ç’©’•÷Ä’®÷â
 Lesson 1
  • How to setup SQL server, management studio, other related programs

 

 Lesson 2-5
  •  SQL Syntax (SQL Statements) SQL Server Keys, Constraints and Indexes, SQL Datatype
  • Introduction to SQL (Introduction To Database, What is SQL Server, Usage of SQL Server, Design, Setup SQL server)

 

 Lesson 6-7
  • Join types (Left, right, full)

 

 Lesson 8
  • Data Definition Language (DDL) basics, CREATE, ALTER, DROP, TRUNCATE

 

 Lesson 9
  • Data Manipulation Language (DML) basics
  • SELECT ‚Äì retrieve data from the a database
  • INSERT ‚Äì insert data into a table
  • UPDATE ‚Äì updates existing data within a table
  • DELETE ‚Äì deletes all records from a table, the space for the records remain
  • MERGE ‚Äì UPSERT operation (insert or update)
  • LOCK TABLE ‚Äì control concurrency

 

 Lesson 10
  • Data modeling. Fact and Dimension Table Types, Star Schema, Snow Flake Schema

 

 Lesson 11
  • Dynamic SQL , Dynamic SQL technique

 

 Lesson 12
  • SQL Stored Procedures, Parameters, Variables, Control-of-flow statements, Functions

title: ¬´POWER BI (BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE)¬ª ’ï’Ü‘º‘±’Ö’Ü ‘¥‘±’ç‘∏’Ü‘π‘±’ë
content:
’à’û’í’Ñ ’Ä‘±’Ñ‘±’ê ‘∑ ’Ü‘±‘Ω‘±’è‘µ’ç’é‘±‘æ

‘¥’°’Ω’®’∂’©’°÷Å’® ’∂’°’≠’°’ø’•’Ω’æ’°’Æ ’ß ’æ’•÷Ä’¨’∏÷Ç’Æ’°’¢’°’∂’∂’•÷Ä’´, ÷Ü’´’∂’°’∂’Ω’´’Ω’ø’∂’•÷Ä’´, ’¢’´’¶’∂’•’Ω’¥’•’∂’∂’•÷Ä’´, ’∞’°’∑’æ’°’∫’°’∞’∂’•÷Ä’´, ’æ’´’≥’°’Ø’°’£’´÷Ä’∂’•÷Ä’´ ’∞’°’¥’°÷Ä, ’∏’æ÷Ñ’•÷Ä ’∞’•’ø’°÷Ñ÷Ä÷Ñ÷Ä’æ’°’Æ ’•’∂ ’¢’°’¶’°’∂’•÷Ä’´ ’∞’•’ø ’Ø’°’∫’°’Ø÷Å’æ’°’Æ ’°’∑’≠’°’ø’°’∂÷Ñ’∏’æ, ’´’∂÷Ü’∏÷Ä’¥’°÷Å’´’°’µ’´ ’¥’∑’°’Ø’¥’°’∂ ’Æ’°’æ’°’¨’∂’•÷Ä’´ ÷á ’¥’•’©’∏’§’∂’•÷Ä’´ ’®’∂’§’¨’°’µ’∂’∏÷Ç’¥’∏’æ: ‘Ω’∏’Ω’æ’•’¨’∏÷Ç ’ß ’ø’°÷Ä’¢’•÷Ä ’∞’°÷Ä’©’°’Ø’∂’•÷Ä’´ ’∞’•’ø (SQL, web ÷á ’°’µ’¨’∂) ’∞’°÷Ä÷Å’∏÷Ç’¥’∂’•÷Ä ’Ω’ø’•’≤’Æ’•’¨’∏÷Ç, ’§÷Ä’°’∂÷Ñ ’¥’∏’§’´÷Ü’´’Ø’°÷Å’∂’•’¨’∏÷Ç, ’ø’°÷Ä’¢’•÷Ä ÷Ü’∏÷Ä’¥’°’ø’´ ’°’≤’¢’µ’∏÷Ç÷Ä’∂’•÷Ä’∏÷Ç’¥ ’£’ø’∂’æ’∏’≤ ’¥’´ ÷Ñ’°’∂’´ ’ø’æ’µ’°’¨’∂’•÷Ä’´ ’¢’°’¶’°’∂’•÷Ä’´ ’Ø’°’∫’°’Ø÷Å’¥’°’∂ ÷á ’Ø’∏’¥’∫’¨’•÷Ñ’Ω ’æ’•’¨’∏÷Ç’Æ’°’Ø’°’∂ ’¥’∑’°’Ø’¥’°’∂ ’∞’∂’°÷Ä’°’æ’∏÷Ä’∏÷Ç’©’µ’∏÷Ç’∂’∂’•÷Ä’´, OLAP-’Ø’∏÷Ç’¢’•÷Ä’´, ’æ’´’¶’∏÷Ç’°’¨’´’¶’°÷Å’´’°’µ’´ ’®’∂’§’¨’°’µ’∂’æ’°’Æ ’∞’∂’°÷Ä’°’æ’∏÷Ä’∏÷Ç’©’µ’∏÷Ç’∂’∂’•÷Ä’´ ’∏÷Ç ’§÷Ä’°’∂’∏’æ ’∞’•’º’°’∞’°÷Ä ’°’∑’≠’°’ø’°’∂÷Ñ’´ ’¥’°’Ω’´’∂:

 

‘µ’û’ê‘≤, ’à’ê’è‘µ’û ’Ç ‘µ’é ‘ª’û’Ü’â ’è‘µ’é’à’Ç’à’í‘π’Ö‘±’Ñ‘≤

‘µ’û’ê‘≤: ’ç’Ø’Ω’°’Æ ’∞’∏÷Ç’∂’´’Ω’´ 15-’´÷Å` ’•÷Ä’•’Ø’∏’µ’°’∂ 20.00-22.00 ’®’∂’Ø’°’Æ ’∞’°’ø’æ’°’Æ’∏÷Ç’¥:

’à’ê’è‘µ’û ’Ç: ‘¥’°’Ω’®’∂’©’°÷Å’® ’°’∂÷Å’Ø’°÷Å’æ’∏÷Ç’¥ ’ß ÷Ö’∂’¨’°’µ’∂ ÷Ü’∏÷Ä’¥’°’ø’∏’æ’ù Skype ’≠’¥’¢’°’µ’´’∂ ’¶’°’∂’£’´ ’¥’´’ª’∏÷Å’∏’æ:

‘ª’û’Ü’â ’è‘µ’é’à’Ç’à’í‘π’Ö‘±’Ñ‘≤: ‘¥’°’Ω’®’∂’©’°÷Å’® ’Ø’°’¶’¥’æ’°’Æ ’ß 12 ’§’°’Ω’´÷Å (+ ’§’°’Ω’°’¥’´’ª’µ’°’∂ ÷Ö’∂’¨’°’µ’∂ ’Ø’∏’∂’Ω’∏÷Ç’¨’ø’°÷Å’´’°), ’∏÷Ä’∏’∂÷Ñ ’Ø’°’∂÷Å’Ø’°÷Å’æ’•’∂ ’∑’°’¢’°’©’°’Ø’°’∂ 2 ’°’∂’£’°’¥` ’•÷Ä’Ø’∏÷Ç’∑’°’¢’©’´ ÷á ’∞’´’∂’£’∑’°’¢’©’´ ÷Ö÷Ä’•÷Ä’´’∂:

 

’ñ’à’ê’Ñ‘±’è‘∏
’ï÷Ü’¨’°’µ’∂ ÷á/’Ø’°’¥ ÷Ö’∂’¨’°’µ’∂, ’°’µ’Ω ’°’∂’£’°’¥’ù o’∂’¨’°’µ’∂: ‘¥’°’Ω’•÷Ä’´ ’∞’•’ø ‘±’Ü’é’É‘±’ê ’ø÷Ä’°’¥’°’§÷Ä’æ’∏÷Ç’¥ ’•’∂ ¬´‘≤’°’¶’°’µ’´’∂ Excel¬ª ÷á ¬´‘Ω’∏÷Ä’°÷Å’æ’°’Æ Excel¬ª ’§’°’Ω’®’∂’©’°÷Å’∂’•÷Ä’´ ’æ’´’§’•’∏’∂’µ’∏÷Ç’©’•÷Ä’®÷â

’à’í’ç’à’í’Ñ’Ü‘±‘ø‘±’Ü ’ä‘º‘±’Ü

 Lesson 1

WHAT IS POWER BI?

  • How to setup POWER BI server, management studio, other related programs
  • Power BI is a suite of Business Analytics tools to analyze data and share insights. Power BI dashboards provide a 360-degree view for business users with their most important metrics in one place, updated in real time, and available on all of their devices.

POWER BI INTRO

Microsoft introduced the idea of Self-Service Business Intelligence (BI) back in 2009

  • Power BI Service (online) ‚Äì general use
  • Power BI Desktop ‚Äì used for more advanced options. You can easily move to this later on.

ADDITION POWER BI SQL

  • Join types (Left, rigt, full)
  • Introduction to SQL (Introduction To Database, What is SQL Server, Usage of SQL Server, Design, Setup SQL Server)
  • SQL Syntax (SQL Statements) SQL Server Keys, Constraints and Indexes, SQL Datatype

FEATURES OF POWER BI

  • Easy to setup
  • Access your data wherever it is
  • Real Time reports
  • Ask questions and get answers
  • Make data-driven decisions from anywhere
  • Integrate your application or service with Power BI
 Lesson 2 - Lesson 3

BLOCKS OF POWER BI

  • Visualizations
  • Datasets
  • Reports
  • Dashboards
  • Tiles

POWER BI TOOLS

  • Power BI Desktop
  • Power BI Service
  • Power BI Mobile
  • Power BI Gateway

CONNECTING TO DATA SOURCES

  • Importing data from Excel
  • Importing data from CSV / Text
  • Importing data from SQL Server database
  • Importing data from SSAS Importing data from Web
  • Importing data from REST APIs Importing data from PDFs
  • Importing data from Google Sheets
  • Importing data from Google BigQuery Understanding Direct Query Understanding Live Connect
  • GETTING DATA FROM FACEBOOK
 Lesson 4

TRANSFORMING DATA

  • Removing columns
  • Selecting columns
  • Removing rows
  • Using first row as headers
  • Adding custom columns
  • Adding index columns
  • Adding columns from examples
  • Splitting columns
  • Merging columns
  • Grouping columns
  • Renaming columns
  • Pivoting a column
  • Unpivoting columns
  • Expanding hierarchical columns
 Lesson 5 - Lesson 6

DATA FORMATTING

  • Auto-detecting data types
  • Changing data types
  • Changing text formatting and cleansing text
  • Adding prefixes / suffixes Replacing values

GENERAL QUERY OPERATIONS

  • Duplicating queries
  • Referencing queries
  • Enabling query load
  • Enabling query in report
  • refresh Viewing query dependencies
  • Merging queries, Appending queries
 Lesson 7

QUERY PROGRAMMING

  • Creating custom functions and using parameters
  • Using M language / advanced editor

MODELING DATA

  • Basic understanding of DAX Adding
  • calculated columns
  • Adding calculated measures
  • Adding calculated tables
  • Understanding of contexts
  • Understanding data types
  • Knowledge of common DAX functions
  • Linking entities & managing relationships
  • Creating hierarchies
  • Creating groups Setting field formats and categories
  • Quick measures Editing field metadata
  • Specifying default sorting
  • Generating parameters for "What if" scenarios
  • Managing roles Managing model views
  • Hiding fields Making the model consumable by Q&A
Lesson 8 - Lesson 11

VISUALISING, ANALYSING & PRESENTING DATA

  • Adding visuals to the report
  • Adding drillthrough to another page
  • Adding drillthrough to another report (cross-report)
  • Knowledge of all available standard slicer types
  • Enabling search on a slicer
  • Changing report size
  • Changing the report theme
  • Using drill down / up functionality Bar / column charts
  • Tables Line chart Area / combined chart
  • Card
  • Tables Matrix
  • Map
  • Ribbon
  • chart
  • Scatter chart
  • Waterfall chart
Lesson 12

CUSTOM VISUALS

  • Using custom visuals
  • Text filter
  • Power KPI
  • Time brush slicer

title: ¬´MS EXCEL-‘ª 160+1 ’ñ’à’í’Ü‘ø’ë‘ª‘±¬ª ‘¥‘±’ç‘∏’Ü‘π‘±’ë
content:
’à’û’í’Ñ ’Ä‘±’Ñ‘±’ê ‘∑ ’Ü‘±‘Ω‘±’è‘µ’ç’é‘±‘æ

‘¥’°’Ω’®’∂’©’°÷Å’® ’∂’°’≠’°’ø’•’Ω’æ’°’Æ ’ß ’∂÷Ä’°’∂÷Å ’∞’°’¥’°÷Ä, ’∏’æ÷Ñ’•÷Ä ÷Å’°’∂’Ø’°’∂’∏÷Ç’¥ ’•’∂ ’°’º’°’æ’•’¨’°’£’∏÷Ç’µ’∂’Ω ’°÷Ä’§’µ’∏÷Ç’∂’°’æ’•’ø ÷Ö’£’ø’æ’•’¨ ÷Ü’∏÷Ç’∂’Ø÷Å’´’°’∂’•÷Ä’´÷Å ÷á ’§÷Ä’°’∂÷Å ’∂’•÷Ä’§÷Ä’æ’°’Æ ’Ø’´÷Ä’°’º’¥’°’∂ ’°÷Ä’§’µ’∏÷Ç’∂÷Ñ’∏÷Ç’¥ ’¨’∏÷Ç’Æ’•’¨ ’¥’´’∂’π ’°’∂’¨’∏÷Ç’Æ’•’¨’´ ’©’æ’°÷Å’∏’≤ ’¢’°’¶’¥’°’©’´’æ ’≠’∂’§’´÷Ä’∂’•÷Ä:

‘±’µ’Ω ’Ø’°’¶’¥’∏’æ ÷Ü’∏÷Ç’∂’Ø÷Å’´’°’∂’•÷Ä’´ ’´’¥’°÷Å’∏÷Ç’©’µ’∏÷Ç’∂’® ’©’∏÷Ç’µ’¨ ’Ø’ø’° ’¢’°÷Ä’±÷Ä’°’∂’°’¨ ’∏÷Ä’°’Ø’°’∫’•’Ω ’∂’∏÷Ä ’¥’°’Ø’°÷Ä’§’°’Ø’´. ’π’ß’û ’∏÷Ä 160+1 ÷Ü’∏÷Ç’∂’Ø÷Å’´’°’µ’´ ’´’¥’°÷Å’∏÷Ç’©’µ’∏÷Ç’∂’∂ ’°’¥’•’∂÷á’´’∂ ’ß’¨ 160+1 ÷Ü’∏÷Ç’∂’Ø÷Å’´’°’µ’´ ’´’¥’°÷Å’∏÷Ç’©’µ’∏÷Ç’∂ ’π’ß: ‘ª’∂’π’∫’•’û’Ω: ‘±’µ’∏‚Äô, 160+1 ÷Ü’∏÷Ç’∂’Ø÷Å’´’°’∂’•÷Ä ’∞’°’¥’°’§÷Ä’•’¨’∏’æ` ‘¥’∏÷Ç÷Ñ ’Ø’°÷Ä’∏’≤ ’•÷Ñ ÷Ü’°’∂’ø’°’Ω’ø’´’Ø ’°÷Ä’§’µ’∏÷Ç’∂÷Ñ’∂’•÷Ä’´ ’∞’°’Ω’∂’•’¨ ÷á ’∞’°’¥’∏’¶’æ’•’¨, ’∏÷Ä Excel-’´ ’∞’°’¥’°÷Ä ’°’∂’∞’∂’°÷Ä ’£÷Ä’•’©’• ’∏’π’´’∂’π ’π’Ø’°: ‘±’µ’∂’∫’•’Ω ’∏÷Ä, ’©’´’æ’® ’¢’°’¶’¥’°’∫’°’ø’Ø’•÷Ñ 100-’∏’æ, ÷á ’§÷Ä’°’∂÷Å’∏’æ ’Ø’¨’∏÷Ç’Æ’•÷Ñ ’¥’∏’ø 16 000 ’≠’∂’§’´÷Ä:

‘µ’û’ê‘≤, ’à’ê’è‘µ’û ’Ç ‘µ’é ‘ª’û’Ü’â ’è‘µ’é’à’Ç’à’í‘π’Ö‘±’Ñ‘≤

‘µ’û’ê‘≤: ’ç’Ø’Ω’°’Æ ÷É’•’ø÷Ä’æ’°÷Ä’´ 16-’´÷Å` ’•÷Ä’•’Ø’∏’µ’°’∂ 19.00-21.00 ’®’∂’Ø’°’Æ ’∞’°’ø’æ’°’Æ’∏÷Ç’¥:

’à’ê’è‘µ’û ’Ç: ÷Ñ. ‘µ÷Ä÷á’°’∂, ‘±÷Ä’∑’°’Ø’∏÷Ç’∂’µ’°÷Å 2` ¬´’è’´’£÷Ä’°’∂ ’Ñ’•’Æ¬ª ’∞÷Ä’°’ø’°÷Ä’°’Ø’π’∏÷Ç’©’µ’∏÷Ç’∂, 3-÷Ä’§ ’∞’°÷Ä’Ø:

‘ª’û’Ü’â ’è‘µ’é’à’Ç’à’í‘π’Ö‘±’Ñ‘≤: ‘¥’°’Ω’®’∂’©’°÷Å’® ’Ø’°’¶’¥’æ’°’Æ ’ß 6 ’§’°’Ω’´÷Å (+ ’§’°’Ω’°’¥’´’ª’µ’°’∂ ÷Ö’∂’¨’°’µ’∂ ’Ø’∏’∂’Ω’∏÷Ç’¨’ø’°÷Å’´’°), ’∏÷Ä’∏’∂÷Ñ ’Ø’°’∂÷Å’Ø’°÷Å’æ’•’∂ ’∑’°’¢’°’©’°’Ø’°’∂ 2 ’°’∂’£’°’¥` ’∞’´’∂’£’∑’°’¢’©’´ ÷á ’•÷Ä’Ø’∏÷Ç’∑’°’¢’©’´ ÷Ö÷Ä’•÷Ä’´’∂÷â

’ñ’à’ê’Ñ‘±’è‘∏
’ï÷Ü’¨’°’µ’∂ ÷á/’Ø’°’¥ ÷Ö’∂’¨’°’µ’∂: ‘¥’°’Ω’•÷Ä’´ ’∞’•’ø ‘±’Ü’é’É‘±’ê ’ø÷Ä’°’¥’°’§÷Ä’æ’∏÷Ç’¥ ’ß ¬´‘≤’°’¶’°’µ’´’∂ Excel¬ª ’æ’´’§’•’∏’§’°’Ω’®’∂’©’°÷Å’´ ’∂’µ’∏÷Ç’©’®÷â

’ñ’∏÷Ç’∂’Ø÷Å’´’°’∂’•÷Ä’´ ÷Å’∏÷Ç÷Å’°’Ø’®

  • ’è’•÷Ñ’Ω’ø’°’µ’´’∂‚Äì Concatenate, Dollar, Fixed, Proper, Upper, Unichar, Unicode, Lower, Right, Left, Mid, Exact, Rept, Text, Trim, T, Code, Clean, Char, Len, Substitute, Search, Value, Replace, Find,
